conversation.content: Hi, I'm calling about my mom's account, I think there's something wrong with her billing?
Oh. Okay. Let me—no wait—I need to, um... the account number. Do you have it? Should be like ACC and then some numbers.
She's eighty-two and gets confused with this stuff, so I usually help her out. The account is under Dorothy Chen?
Right right. Found it. ACC-5582-DMC. So there's a—how do I... there's a note here. About authorization. I need to, uh, verify you're listed?
I think I'm on there as her authorized contact? She added me last year when she had that mini stroke.

Checking checking. Oh. Um. I see you—Michael Chen? Listed October. That's good. So the billing issue is... what's the word... it's showing double charges. For three months. $247.89 each. That's—I'm really sorry about that.
Three months? She probably didn't even notice, she barely checks her statements anymore.
Yeah that's—I mean—that happens. With elderly customers. Not their fault. At all. So the total is, uh, $743.67 in overcharges. Reference OVR-2847-KBN. I can process the refund?
That would be great, I mean, she's on a fixed income so every dollar kind of matters right now.
Absolutely absolutely. Starting it now. Transaction TRX-9823-QWE is processing. Should hit in 3-5 days. But also—let me just—there's something else. Her plan.
What about her plan? Is something wrong with that too?
Not wrong. Just. She's on our, um... legacy unlimited? From 2018? Paying way too much. The new senior rate—code SEN-DISC-55—that's like half the price. Same features.
Oh. She probably has no idea there's even a cheaper option.
Right. Happens all the time. So I'm gonna—wait let me—actually I can switch her right now. New plan PLN-4429-SR starts next cycle. Saves her... calculating... $58 monthly.
That's really helpful actually, between her medications and everything else, that'll make a difference.
Good good. Also setting up—what do you call it—the monitoring? Alert code ALT-7736-FAM. You'll get emails if anything weird happens. Double charges. Plan changes. Whatever.
I really appreciate this, I worry about her getting taken advantage of, you know?
Totally understand. My grandma—same thing. So everything's fixed. Refund REF-2983-XLP is processing. New plan active. You're all set.
Thank you, this is probably the best customer service call I've had in years, honestly.
Just doing my job. But, uh... yeah. Take care of your mom. The confirmation—CNF-8827-DMC—that's going to both emails. Yours and hers.
